pages.title: Report an outbreak of acute respiratory infection in an adult social care setting

components.name: nMOTrx
components.content: Applies to England

components.name: nMOTry
components.content:
You can use this service if you provide adult social care, such as a care home, retirement home, supported living or extra care.

Use this service to report:

  • a new outbreak of an acute respiratory infection (ARI) - 2 or more people in your setting with symptom onset within 5 days of each other
  • a single confirmed case of flu in your setting

ARIs include COVID-19, flu, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), or unknown respiratory infection including chest infections.

It should take about 10 minutes to complete.

Before you start

If possible, test all service users with symptoms who are eligible for COVID-19 treatments using a COVID-19 rapid lateral flow test. Staff with symptoms who are eligible for COVID-19 treatments should test themselves at home.

If you cannot test people, do not wait. Report as soon as possible.

You'll need to know the:

  • setting postcode
  • total number of service users and staff in your setting
  • number of service users and staff with symptoms
  • dates when people's symptoms started
  • test results for anyone tested for any ARI, for example COVID-19, flu or RSV
  • number of service users and staff vaccinated for COVID-19 and flu

Updating about an existing outbreak

Do not use this online service to give an update on an outbreak or cluster of ARI that you've already reported. If you need to give an update, contact your local UKHSA health protection team or your community infection control team.

Identifying an ARI outbreak

You only need to report 2 or more ARI cases if they could be linked by spread in your setting. If the infection could not have been spread in your setting, you should not report it as an outbreak. If in doubt, report as an outbreak.

Do not use this service to report:

  • single cases of COVID-19
  • any infection other than acute respiratory infections

Read more on:

  • infection prevention and control in adult social care: acute respiratory infection
  • identifying and treating respiratory infections on the NHS website

Why you should report an outbreak

Your local UKHSA health protection team, or the community infection control team, will use your information to assess your outbreak. They will help you manage the outbreak and prevent further spread.

Get help

If you need help using the service or have any other questions, contact your local UKHSA health protection team during working hours.

If your enquiry is urgent outside of working hours, telephone your health protection team's out-of-hours service.

If you need urgent medical advice

If you need urgent medical advice, you should call NHS 111 or visit 111.nhs.uk. For life-threatening emergencies, call 999.

pages.title: Acute Respiratory Infections (ARI) - COVID-19, Flu or unknown infection in Adult Social Care settings

components.name: S0Q4
components.title: Your setting postcode
components.hint: Give the postcode of your care setting, not the management company. If you provide domiciliary or home care, enter the postcode of the care provider company.

components.name: S0Q3

customValidationMessages.string.empty: Your local UKHSA health protection team is required
customValidationMessages.string.base: Your local UKHSA health protection team is required

components.title: Your local UKHSA health protection team

components.name: cstZQG
components.content: Use your postcode to find your local health protection team (opens in a new tab)

components.name: S0Q2
components.title: Your Care Quality Commission (CQC) location ID

components.name: rIpMWq
components.content: or

components.name: S0Q5
components.title: My setting is not registered with the CQC

components.name: VMOkqi
components.content: Find your CQC location ID in the care directory on the CQC website (opens in a new tab).

components.name: rIpMWr
components.content:
<script>
document.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', function() {
const cqcIdText = document.getElementById('S0Q2');
const cqcIdCheckbox = document.getElementById('S0Q5');
function updateTextFieldRequiredState() {
const isChecked = cqcIdCheckbox.checked;
cqcIdText.required = !isChecked;
}
function clearCheckbox() {
cqcIdCheckbox.checked = false;
}
cqcIdCheckbox.addEventListener('change', function() {
if (cqcIdCheckbox.checked) {
cqcIdText.value = '';
}
updateTextFieldRequiredState();
});
cqcIdText.addEventListener('input', function() {
if (cqcIdText.value !== '') {
clearCheckbox();
}
updateTextFieldRequiredState()
});
});
</script>

components.name: S4Q2
components.title: S4Q2. What is the total number of resident-client COVID-19 cases in the outbreak you are reporting (LFD confirmed only)?

Please include those with COVID-19 who are currently hospitalised or on visits out
</br>
If zero then please enter 0

components.hint:
Please note that you are not required to test symptomatic staff for COVID-19
</br>
Please include those who are currently hospitalised with COVID-19
</br>

declaration:
Your responses may be shared with your local UKHSA health protection team, your local authority community infection control team, and the NHS. They will use your information to help you to manage your situation.

By submitting this report you confirm that the details you are providing are correct to the best of your knowledge. You confirm that you have not included any personally identifiable information, for example names or dates of birth
name: Prototype Report An Outbreak
